text: Mont-de-Marsan is a commune in southwestern France, in the region of Nouvelle- Aquitaine. It is the prefecture (capital) of the Landes department. and the capital of the arrondissement of Mont-de-Marsan. It is also the capital of 2 cantons in the department: Mont-de-Marsan-1 and Mont-de-Marsan-2. ==Geography== Mont-de-Marsan is at the confluence of two rivers, the Douze and the Midou, forming the river Midouze just in the centre of the city. It has an area of , and its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . Mont-de-Marsan and its neighboring communes Mont-de-Marsan is surrounded by the communes Uchacq-et-Parentis, Saint-Avit, Mazerolles, Bretagne-de-Marsan, Saint-Pierre-du-Mont and Campet-et-Lamolère. ===Climate=== The climate of Mont-de-Marsan is Marine West Coast Climate (Köppen climate classification: Cfb), with mild winters and warm summers. The average temperature for the year in Mont-de-Marsan is 13.5 °C (56.3 °F). The warmest month, on average, is July with an average temperature of 21.4 °C (70.5 °F). The coolest month on average is January, with an average temperature of 6.2 °C (43.2 °F). The average amount of precipitation for the year in Mont-de-Marsan is . The month with the most precipitation on average is October with of precipitation. The month with the least precipitation on average is August with an average of . ==Population== The inhabitants of Mont-de-Marsan are known, in French, as Montois (women: Montoises). With a population of 31,009, Mont-de-Marsan has a population density of inhabitants/km2. This urban area is the centre of the metropolitan area of Mont-de-Marsan, formed by 47 communes, with a population of 70,724 inhabitants (2013) and an area of . ==Administration== Mont-de-Marsan is the prefecture of the Landes department since 1790. It is also the capital of the arrondissement of Mont-de-Marsan and the administrative centre () of two cantons: # Mont-de-Marsan-1, formed with a part of Mont-de-Marsan and nine other communes, with 25,707 inhabitants (2014). # Mont-de-Marsan-2, formed with a part of Mont-de-Marsan and eight other communes, with 28,390 inhabitants (2014). === Twin towns === Mont-de- Marsan is twinned with: * Alingsås, Sweden, since 1956 * Tudela, Spain, since 1986 ==Gallery== File:MDM Lacataye.JPG|Donjon Lacataye close to the Midou river. File:PLace St Roch MDM.JPG|Saint-Roch square. File:Théâtre (M2M).JPG|Theatre and Charles de Gaulle square. File:Musée Dubalen (Mont-de- Marsan, France).JPG|Dubalen museum. ==Monuments and sites== * The Donjon Lacataye is the keep of a 14th century castle * Despiau-Wlérick Museum (1930s sculpture by two local artists) ==Sport== * Stade Montois: The city's football and rugby team. ==People born in Mont-de Marsan== * Pierre Bosquet, Marshal of France, (1810 - 1861) * Charles Despiau, sculptor, (1874 - 1946) * Robert Wlérick, sculptor, (1882 – 1944) * Alain Juppé, politician and former Prime Minister of France, (1945 - ) * Patrick Biancone, Thoroughbred horse racing trainer, (1952 - ) * Thomas Castaignède, rugby union footballer, (1975 - ) * Paul Astin, Marathon runner, (1986 – ) * Fabien Vehlmann, comics writer, (1972 - ) ==Related pages== * Arrondissement of Mont-de-Marsan * Communes of the Landes department ==References== ==Other websites== * Ville de Mont-de-Marsan - Official site * Departmental Council of Landes * Prefecture official website * Région Nouvelle-Aquitaine Category:Communes in Landes Category:Departmental capitals in France
title: Mont-de-Marsan
